title: Electrician is mauled by caretaker's pet LION after he complained he had not been paid for work
text:
An electrician was mauled by a caretaker's pet lion that he unleashed after complaining that he hadn't been paid for work he did on a religious building in Pakistan.

The caretaker has now been charged with attempted murder, according to local media.

According to the police, electrician Mohammad Rafique didn't file a complaint against Ali Raza for a whole month.

According to the police, electrician Mohammad Rafique didn't file a complaint against Ali Raza for a whole month

It was only when Raza, a caretaker of a congregation hall in Sada-e-Imam Hussain, refused to pay for Rafique's medical treatment and compensation that he reported it to police.

Rafique had been hired to work on the building of the congregation hall but when he demanded wages after completing the job, Raza told him to come later.

According to Gulf News, police said: 'The caretaker kept delayed the payment.

'But when Rafique persisted, Raza got annoyed and unleashed his pet lion on him.

'The lion wounded his face and arm.'

Rafique's cries for help caught the attention of passersby who rescued him from the lion.
description: Mohammad Rafique was mauled by the lion after demanding his wages from Ali Raza, who had hired him to work on the building of a congregation hall in Sada-e-Imam Hussain in Pakistan.
